result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dequaylow W Burks

records.addlTxt: No Appearances by the State or Defense. Court adjourns this matter for Status Conference on 11/21/2022 at 8:45 a.m. in Br. 9.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense; signed, filed, and distributed.
Attorney Gregg Novack

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in Court, in custody. Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr on behalf of Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in Court for State of Wisconsin.

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE VAN GRUNSVEN, BRANCH 9. 
Case called on the record with Defendant's cases, 22CF38 and 22CF767, in Branch 46. 
Discussion placed on the record. State Public Defender's Office failed to timely appoint counsel for the Defendant. Statements by Defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel at COUNTY EXPENSE. Court appointed Attorney Gregg Novack to represent Defendant in this matter at County Expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court ordered the Defendant is NOT REQUIRED to reimburse Milwaukee County; however, Court ordered the Defendant to pay a one-time fee of $60.00 by the completion of the case. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing, Branch 9. Court VACATED Status Conference date of October 17, 2022. 

Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am. Defendant and Defense will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf for Michael Schindhelm in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing.  Defendant advises the Court he has not yet retained private counsel. Defendant also has two cases in Branch 46: 22CF767 and 22CF38 scheduled for Status of Counsel on 10-12-22 at 8:30am in Room 113 SB.  Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter for further Status of Counsel hearing.  Defendant allowed to appear via zoom for next hearing date. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in custody, appeared via video.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Pre-trial Conference. Defense has filed Motion to Withdraw as Counsel.  Defendant wishes to retain private counsel.  Motion GRANTED.  Court orders Attorney Galang to contact the Public Defender's office of his withdrawal and for appointment of new counsel.  Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Status of Counsel. Defendant may appear via zoom for next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State informs Court that there still may be outstanding discovery. Court will extend deadline for the State to turnover all discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports. Parties to personally discuss to ensure that all discovery has been exchanged by 06/30/2022. Court sets 08/17/2022 as the deadline to file any motions or change of plea documents. Branch 17 would accept defendant's other two cases for a global resolution on 08/19/2022 if allowed by Judge Feiss, Court will not allow this case to be transferred to another branch. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court, defendant Dequaylow W Burks not in court, in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court scheduled the following filing deadlines. State has until May 31st, 2022, to file discovery to the State. Parties has until June 15th, 2022 to file any motions. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in court with attorney Paul John Galganski.  Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of MKE Police Officer Richard Klarkowski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in court with Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang who appears as a friend of the Court.  Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Galang to be appointed and needs time to review the matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks not in court, defendant in custody.   Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dequaylow W Burks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
